title: References (Part 7)
content:
References

References (Part 7)

Continued References [91-103]

  • [91] Chongkai Gao et al. - Flip: Flow-centric generative planning as general-purpose manipulation world model (2024)
  • [92] Shibo Hao et al. - LLM reasoners: New evaluation, library, and analysis of step-by-step reasoning with large language models (2024)
  • [93] Lei Wang et al. - Plan-and-solve prompting: Improving zero-shot chain-of-thought reasoning (2023)
  • [94] Tengxiao Liu et al. - Plan, verify and switch: Integrated reasoning with diverse x-of-thoughts (2023)
  • [95] Fei Ni et al. - Peria: Perceive, reason, imagine, act via holistic language and vision planning for manipulation (2024)
  • [96] Lutfi Eren Erdogan et al. - Plan-and-act: Improving planning of agents for long-horizon tasks (2025)
  • [97] Jiuxin Wen et al. - Codeplan: Unlocking reasoning potential in large language models by scaling code-form planning (2024)
  • [98] Michael Lutz et al. - Wilbur: Adaptive in-context learning for robust and accurate web agents (2024)
  • [99] Xingyao Wang et al. - CodeAct: Executable code actions elicit better llm agents (2024)
  • [100] Asif Rahman et al. - Marco: Multi-agent code optimization with real-time knowledge integration (2025)
  • [101] Chengbo He et al. - Enhancing llm reasoning with multi-path collaborative reactive and reflection agents (2024)
  • [102] Mrinal Rawat et al. - Pre-act: Multi-step planning and reasoning improves acting in llm agents (2025)
  • [103] Renat Aksitov et al. - Rest meets react: Self-improvement for multi-step reasoning llm agent (2023)

Analysis & Explanation

Planning and Reasoning References

Key Themes
  • Planning Methods: Plan-and-solve, CodePlan, Pre-act
  • Multi-Step Reasoning: Chain-of-thought variations
  • Self-Improvement: Rest meets ReAct, reflection
